page.title: 05Housing in Bwlchysarnau
page.content: Many of the houses in the area are at least 100 years old. Of the 27 houses only 7 have been built during the last 20 years. All of the older houses have been improved, many with the help of local authority improvement grants. Most of the houses have mains water, sewage disposal is by means of septic tanks, and all receive mains electricity connected in the late fifties. Nearly all of the houses have a Rayburn or other solid fuel cooker, sometimes heating additional radiators or with open fires to supplement. Some households burn wood and one or two have oilfired heating.There is no mains gas available. One house has solar panels. Double glazing is beginning to be installed.
